description: Describes a resource server. For more information about resource servers, see Access control with resource servers.

parameters.name: UserPoolId
parameters.description: The ID of the user pool that hosts the resource server.

parameters.name: Identifier
parameters.description: A unique resource server identifier for the resource server. The identifier can be an API friendly name like solar-system-data. You can also set an API URL like https://solar-system-data-api.example.com as your identifier. Amazon Cognito represents scopes in the access token in the format $resource-server-identifier/$scope. Longer scope-identifier strings increase the size of your access tokens.

nested_items.name: ResourceServer
nested_items.description: The details of the requested resource server.

nested_items.name: UserPoolId
nested_items.description: The ID of the user pool that contains the resource server configuration.

nested_items.name: Identifier
nested_items.description: A unique resource server identifier for the resource server. The identifier can be an API friendly name like solar-system-data. You can also set an API URL like https://solar-system-data-api.example.com as your identifier.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the resource server.

nested_items.name: Scopes
nested_items.description: A list of scopes that are defined for the resource server.

nested_items.name: ScopeName
nested_items.description: The name of the scope. Amazon Cognito renders custom scopes in the format resourceServerIdentifier/ScopeName. For example, if this parameter is exampleScope in the resource server with the identifier exampleResourceServer, you request and receive the scope exampleResourceServer/exampleScope.

nested_items.name: ScopeDescription
nested_items.description: A friendly description of a custom scope.
